examples: Don't worry about breaking the bank either.
I know that I'm often my worst enemy, but he's not that innocent either.
All my friends were either lovey-dovey couples or wild, single girls.
A door must be either shut or open.
The first batters either missed or walked.
words.defineEn: used to introduce two choices or possibilities
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để giới thiệu hai lựa chọn hoặc khả năng

examples: Once the supreme leader has issued the fatwa, that fatwa is not only a religious fatwa, but it is something, a decree.
Once the supreme leader has issued the fatwa, that fatwa is not only a religious fatwa, but it is something, a decree.
Once the supreme leader has issued the fatwa, that fatwa is not only a religious fatwa, but it is something, a decree.
Sorry to hear about the fatwa, buddy.
But, in reality, when it comes to action, we do what the fatwa says.
words.defineEn: a legal decision or statement made by an Islamic leader
words.defineVi: một quyết định pháp lý hoặc tuyên bố của một nhà lãnh đạo Hồi giáo

examples: Find a hobby.
After all, love will find a way.
Water will always find its own level.
She found a dirty stain on her favorite shirt.
The court found in her favor.
words.defineEn: (of a law court) to make an official decision
words.defineVi: (của tòa án) đưa ra quyết định chính thức

words.defineEn: to declare someone guilty or make a decision against someone in a court case
words.defineVi: để tuyên bố ai đó có tội hoặc đưa ra quyết định chống lại ai đó trong một trường hợp tòa án

words.defineEn: to declare someone right or innocent in a court of law case
words.defineVi: để tuyên bố ai đó đúng hoặc vô tội trong một tòa án của pháp luật trường hợp

examples: The study yielded significant findings that could advance medical research.
The case was continued without a finding until August 2.
What did he make out of the findings of the Emile Short commission?
The scientist had to eat crow and revise their theory after new evidence contradicted their original findings.
The data was presented in graphical form, with charts and diagrams used to illustrate the findings.
words.defineEn: a judgment made by a judge or jury in a court of law
words.defineVi: một bản án được đưa ra bởi một thẩm phán hoặc bồi thẩm đoàn trong một tòa án của pháp luật

words.defineEn: to compel someone to accelerate the process of decision-making
words.defineVi: để buộc ai đó đẩy nhanh quá trình ra quyết định

examples: We all have free will.
But then, do I have free will?
There’s just no room for free will in this picture.
Research like this can even give us fresh insights into the nature of free will.
And to be clear, libertarian free will is nothing like political libertarianism.
words.defineEn: the idea that human beings have the agency to decide independently without being controlled by any outside influences
words.defineVi: ý tưởng rằng con người có cơ quan để quyết định một cách độc lập mà không bị kiểm soát bởi bất kỳ ảnh hưởng bên ngoài nào

words.phonetic: tə ɡɪv slæʃ muːv slæʃ bʌdʒ ɐn ɪntʃ
words.defineEn: (always negative) ‌to refuse to make even a slightest change to one's position, decision, etc.
words.defineVi: (luôn phủ định) ‌từ chối thực hiện một thay đổi dù là nhỏ nhất đối với vị trí, quyết định của một người, v.v.

examples: The startup is developing cutting-edge technology, boldly going where no man has gone before in the quest for innovation.
With only months to go before the deadline, the heat is on.
I wanted to have a meaningful conversation with him when he was back from work but he was gone before I could say Jack Robinson.
Christine Blasey Ford had to go before the eyes of a nation and the world.
He has not gone before television cameras as of now.
words.defineEn: ‌to be presented to someone or something for discussion, decision, or judgment
words.defineVi: được trình bày cho ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó để thảo luận, quyết định hoặc phán xét

examples: Music has been a passion that is handed down from father to son in the Smith family.
With the judge handing down the maximum possible sentence, this monster will be paying the fiddler for the rest of his life.
Best three years of my life, hands down.
A Chinese court handed down a four-year prison sentence today for a citizen journalist who reported on the initial COVID-19 outbreak.
Tomorrow When the War Began, hands down.
words.defineEn: ‌to formally announce something such as a decision or judgment
words.defineVi: ‌để chính thức công bố một cái gì đó như một quyết định hoặc bản án

words.defineEn: to think about something before making a decision
words.defineVi: để suy nghĩ về một cái gì đó trước khi đưa ra quyết định

words.defineEn: to hesitate in making a decision or saying something
words.defineVi: do dự trong việc đưa ra quyết định hoặc nói điều gì đó

words.defineEn: a choice made in a situation in which no other options were available
words.defineVi: một lựa chọn được thực hiện trong một tình huống không có lựa chọn nào khác

examples: She goes hiking every weekend to escape the hustle and bustle of the city.
But the real hustle comes just before the dinner rush.
So they really hustled to close that thing down pretty quickly.
For most musicians, it’s a constant hustle, with little return.
It was of the most intense magic hour hustles in the film.
words.defineEn: to convince or make someone to do something
words.defineVi: để thuyết phục hoặc làm cho một ai đó để làm một cái gì đó

examples: Now, we remember the career of Roger Mudd, a broadcast journalist known for his incisive questioning and tough approach to news, especially in the nation's capital.
words.defineEn: having or showing common sense, and the capability of expressing an idea in a convincing way
words.defineVi: có hoặc thể hiện ý thức chung và khả năng thể hiện một ý tưởng một cách thuyết phục

examples: The scientific evidence remains inconclusive as to whether human activities affect the global climate.
But so far, all scientific studies on the health benefits of coconut oil have been inconclusive, and nutritionists remain skeptical.
The big issue is that a lot of research into sensory deprivation is kind of inconclusive.
And the data's inconclusive when it comes to risk to humans.
Just to recap, the data around cops in schools keeping students safe is inconclusive.
words.defineEn: not producing a clear result or decision
words.defineVi: không tạo ra một kết quả hoặc quyết định rõ ràng

examples: The indecisive job applicant was afraid to apply for his dream job, imagining all the ways he could be rejected.
But he's just indecisive.
Also depression can make you feel indecisive.
First, Putin perceives us as weak, feckless, indecisive, slow to respond.
Two, I'm so indecisive that I'm scared I would get a tattoo and instantly hate it.
words.defineEn: (of a person) having difficulty making choices or decisions, often due to fear, lack of confidence, or overthinking
words.defineVi: (của một người) gặp khó khăn trong việc lựa chọn hoặc quyết định, thường là do sợ hãi, thiếu tự tin hoặc suy nghĩ quá nhiều

examples: This person is extremely inflexible in his thinking.
Basically, farmers are up against an inflexible food supply chain, which is specialized for the end customer.
They're urgent because they have inflexible deadlines.
It’s only when traits get really rigid and people become inflexible in their behaviors that psychologists start to draw the line between a trait and a disorder.
And number four: Is overconscientious scrupulous, and inflexible about matters of morality, ethics, or values.
words.defineEn: reluctant to compromise or change one's attitude, belief, plan, etc.
words.defineVi: miễn cưỡng thỏa hiệp hoặc thay đổi thái độ, niềm tin, kế hoạch, v.v.

examples: The U.S. tax code now loads the dice in favor of private pension plans.
The courts decided in favor of the New York claimants.
This support has dramatically tilted the balance of power in favor of the Algerian ruling elite.
The company abandoned its outdated marketing strategy in favor of a more innovative approach.
We received information that would load the dice in favor of our arguments.
words.defineEn: in agreement; in support of something or someone
words.defineVi: trong thỏa thuận; để hỗ trợ của một cái gì đó hoặc một ai đó

words.defineEn: in a way that gives someone an advantage over something or someone
words.defineVi: theo cách mang lại cho ai đó một lợi thế hơn một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

words.defineEn: used for saying that choosing out of the two possible options is not really going to make a difference as the result will be the same either way
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói rằng việc chọn trong số hai tùy chọn có thể sẽ không thực sự tạo ra sự khác biệt vì kết quả sẽ giống nhau theo cả hai cách

words.word: it [is] six of one (and|) half a dozen of the other
words.phonetic: ɪɾ ɪz sɪks ʌv wʌn ænd hæf ɐ dʌzən ʌvðɪ ʌðɚ
words.defineEn: used to say that both options or situations are equal and that none is better or worse than the other
words.defineVi: dùng để nói rằng cả hai lựa chọn hoặc tình huống đều bình đẳng và không cái nào tốt hơn hay tệ hơn cái nào

words.defineEn: used to express indifference toward the options or choices that are offered
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện sự thờ ơ đối với các tùy chọn hoặc lựa chọn được cung cấp

words.defineEn: (in the US) an official statement or decision that has been approved by both houses of the US Congress
words.defineVi: (ở Mỹ) một tuyên bố hoặc quyết định chính thức đã được cả hai viện của Quốc hội Hoa Kỳ thông qua
